content_1: Egypt. The government of Egypt is launching a program to monitor migrant birds in order to determine which ones are able to transmit highly pathogenic H5N1. Hong Kong. A crested myna found dead at Shan Tau on Feb. 12 is suspected of carrying a strain of H5 influenza. Further confirmatory tests are being conducted. India.  Lucknow has begun to scan for H5N1 in water birds. The Bombay Natural History Society will take the lead in the three year project.
